content.raw:
I added a deprecation warning. 1eda51d. 


I noticed that the `AttachLightPlugin` was also added in gazebo7 so we're deprecating a feature that was introduced in the same major version.  Once deprecated, does that mean we are going to remove it in default / gazebo9?
content.html:
I added a deprecation warning. 1eda51d.

I noticed that the AttachLightPlugin was also added in gazebo7 so we're deprecating a feature that was introduced in the same major version. Once deprecated, does that mean we are going to remove it in default / gazebo9?

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: I feel like there is a precedent for this but I'm not entirely sure what it was. If I recall correctly, what we did was to deprecate it on all currently released versions (in this case 7 and 8) plus the next release (9). But my head could just be making this up now.
content.html: I feel like there is a precedent for this but I'm not entirely sure what it was. If I recall correctly, what we did was to deprecate it on all currently released versions (in this case 7 and 8) plus the next release (9). But my head could just be making this up now.

content.raw: `sdformat-sdf` is not a versioned package and it's shared across all the sdf versions. It should be backwards compatible.

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw:
this is mainly so that I can reuse the function in Link class to load lights. 

Ideally Link class should have its own `LoadLight` function and store a list of lights there. `FillMsg` should also populate the link msg with lights but that requires updating the proto file and breaks ABI. For simplicity, I reused the World class LoadLight function to create Light and add it to `sceneMsg`so the rendering side gets this info.
content.html:
this is mainly so that I can reuse the function in Link class to load lights.

Ideally Link class should have its own LoadLight function and store a list of lights there. FillMsg should also populate the link msg with lights but that requires updating the proto file and breaks ABI. For simplicity, I reused the World class LoadLight function to create Light and add it to sceneMsgso the rendering side gets this info.

content.raw: Following the pattern of models sounds safe, because that pattern has been working for a while. It should be ABI compatible to add a new topic, right?

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: ya I thought about changing to `/light/info` but was concerned that would break code that are already relying on `/factory/light` to listen to new lights (e.g. gzweb). We could add a new `/light/info` topic and still keep publishing to `/light/factory` for now  and add a warning in migration guide? Note we shouldn't remove `/factory/light` as it's still used for spawning lights.
content.html: ya I thought about changing to /light/info but was concerned that would break code that are already relying on /factory/light to listen to new lights (e.g. gzweb). We could add a new /light/info topic and still keep publishing to /light/factory for now and add a warning in migration guide? Note we shouldn't remove /factory/light as it's still used for spawning lights.

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw:
So just to see if I caught all the things which need to be fixed on a later version (maybe too late for Gazebo 9?)

* Add `Light` field to `link.proto`
* Add `worldPoseDirty` to `physics::Light` and remove infinite pose checks
* Use `Light::GetRelativePose` instead of `Light::GetWorldPose` in a few places
* Add a `Link::lights` variable
* Add `id` field to `light.proto` and remove empty id checks
* Remove `AttachLightPlugin`
content.html:
So just to see if I caught all the things which need to be fixed on a later version (maybe too late for Gazebo 9?)

  • Add Light field to link.proto
  • Add worldPoseDirty to physics::Light and remove infinite pose checks
  • Use Light::GetRelativePose instead of Light::GetWorldPose in a few places
  • Add a Link::lights variable
  • Add id field to light.proto and remove empty id checks
  • Remove AttachLightPlugin

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw:
Also:

* Remove hack that publishes light pose message from physics to rendering 
* In rendering/Scene, update `ProcessLinkMsg` to process lights in link msgs and attach to parent link visual
* In physics/Link, add `LoadLight` function, and update `FillMsg` to add light to msg.
content.html:
Also:

  • Remove hack that publishes light pose message from physics to rendering
  • In rendering/Scene, update ProcessLinkMsg to process lights in link msgs and attach to parent link visual
  • In physics/Link, add LoadLight function, and update FillMsg to add light to msg.

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: Little detail: if I pause the world and change the pose of the light, it stays in that position until I press play and it snaps back to the link. This behaviour is inconsistent with other "immovable" entities, such as links - i.e. it is not allowed to manipulate a single link on the GUI.
content.html: Little detail: if I pause the world and change the pose of the light, it stays in that position until I press play and it snaps back to the link. This behaviour is inconsistent with other "immovable" entities, such as links - i.e. it is not allowed to manipulate a single link on the GUI.

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: ya light are currently stored in World so they are treated the same as lights without parents. This eventually won't be a problem when lights are loaded in Link class. I have changes to prevent them from being modified but those changes would need to be removed when merging forward so I'm tempted to leave this as is. What do you think?
content.html: ya light are currently stored in World so they are treated the same as lights without parents. This eventually won't be a problem when lights are loaded in Link class. I have changes to prevent them from being modified but those changes would need to be removed when merging forward so I'm tempted to leave this as is. What do you think?

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: I'm ok with leaving it as it is and addressing the issue in the future.
content.html: I'm ok with leaving it as it is and addressing the issue in the future.

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw:
Some of the things I checked:

* Light correctly moves with the link
* Deleting a model properly deletes its lights
* Light shows up on the left panel (but under Lights, not under the link name)
* Lights can still be added from the GUI with no issue
* Changing light properties, such as color, from the left panel work - but are not logged or saved (issue #2057)
* Light movement is properly recorded and played back
* The relationship between lights and links is properly saved when the world is saved
* Lights work inside nested models
* When editing a model which has a light in the model editor, after saving the light is gone (we can ticket an issue)
content.html:
Some of the things I checked:

  • Light correctly moves with the link
  • Deleting a model properly deletes its lights
  • Light shows up on the left panel (but under Lights, not under the link name)
  • Lights can still be added from the GUI with no issue
  • Changing light properties, such as color, from the left panel work - but are not logged or saved (issue #2057)
  • Light movement is properly recorded and played back
  • The relationship between lights and links is properly saved when the world is saved
  • Lights work inside nested models
  • When editing a model which has a light in the model editor, after saving the light is gone (we can ticket an issue)

content.raw: Can a light still be independent (i.e. not attached to a model)? If so, does this affect those lights?
content.html: Can a light still be independent (i.e. not attached to a model)? If so, does this affect those lights?

pullrequest.title: Add light as child of link

content.raw: yes light can still be independent. This `if` statement removes scoping of names because previously it was assumed that models and lights are always at the top level. Moving the check for `EntityTypes::Light` to the next `if`statement make sure we keep the scoped names for lights that are attached to links.
content.html: yes light can still be independent. This if statement removes scoping of names because previously it was assumed that models and lights are always at the top level. Moving the check for EntityTypes::Light to the next ifstatement make sure we keep the scoped names for lights that are attached to links.
